subject: Medicine
title: Genomic Surveillance
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Genomic Surveillance.

hook.text: Scientists can read a virus's genetic code and trace exactly where it came from and how it mutated.

buildup.text: Genomic surveillance sequences pathogen DNA from patients to track mutations and transmission chains.

discovery.text: Each mutation is a timestamp. Comparing sequences reveals how the virus traveled between cities and countries.

twist.text: The UK's genomic surveillance program detected the Alpha variant weeks before other countries noticed it.

climax.text: Real-time sequencing is now essential for detecting new variants that might evade vaccines or treatments.

punchline.text: Reading the virus's code reveals its travel diary.

quiz.question: How did genomic surveillance help during COVID-19?
options: It detected new variants like Alpha weeks before other methods
It directly cured patients by reading their DNA
It replaced the need for testing and contact tracing
